fields.description:
h3. Summary
Automation shows an error for the transition configured to run after an auto approval
h3. Environment
(Optional - If Applicable)
* JSD version: 1000.1518.0 (Cloud)
* 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set up a workflow to transition from Review > Planning > Implementation
# Add approval to the Review status and set the transition to approve to transition to the Planning status
# Add an automation to auto approve upon ticket creation then transition to Implementation
#* When: Issue created
#* If: Any items
#* Then: 	Auto-approve/decline=Approve, Transition issue=_transition to Implementation_
# Create a ticket to run the automation

h3. Expected Results
Ticket is approved (transitioned to Planning) then transitioned to Implementaton
h3. Actual Results
Ticket is approved (transitioned to Planning), Error on issue transition.

h3.Workaround
Instead of an approval, use transition to Planning then transition to Implementation.
fields.summary: Automation error when set to transition after approval

fields.description:
The list of portal customers is cumbersome, especially when running to more than 3 pages.

It would be great to have the ability to sort the list by user name/email/last login etc.. It's really annoying to have to manually search through the whole list to find specific people/name types, especially when the list doesn't have a logical auto-sort on it at the start (what is it sorting on?)

Would also be good to have ability to select 'Never Logged in' group from the 'Active' group - currently I have to scroll and manually copy these names out. (Would be a positive addition to the sort ability mentioned above.)
fields.summary: Portal-only List - 'sort by' function / improved search

fields.description:
With the upcoming changes to the cloud pricing to be per user, this suggestion has become even more important which is:

 

*Changing a user with JIRA access to only be a customer i.e. portal only access.* 

 

USE CASE:

The cloud instance I'm currently working on has a number of users who no longer need access to JIRA projects as they only need to use the service desk portal to create and manage their requests OR have been created as a full JIRA user in error. 

 

he only way a user can now have portal only access if they were an existing JIRIt appears that tA user with JIRA access etc (now that the "The Service Desk Customer - Portal Access" checkbox has been removed) is to leave them as a user but remove all their groups. As noted above though, that means that we would end up paying for a user license for someone who should now be a customer only due to internal restructure or user error. 

 

(If I deactivate the user, it will not them log in as a customer only because the email address is already in use and the user has been deactivated.)
fields.summary: Changing former JIRA User to Portal (customer) only

fields.summary: Customer notifications are being delayed

fields.description:
When admins allow customers to access and send requests from the help center without logging in, the customer receives a message like the following after submitting an issue:

 

"Your reference is ABC-123. Check [user@domain.com|mailto:user@domain.com] for a confirmation and updates.

Back to help center"

 

Clicking "Back to help center" will load the generic Customer Portal which multiple Service Desk projects show up in. Users would prefer any customers that click "Back to help center" will be redirected back to the customer portal for the same project they just submitted an issue for.

 

This is to help avoid confusion with customers who can potentially enter issues in the wrong project.
fields.summary: As a JIRA Admin I'd like to redirect Service Desk Customers to the  same Service Desk project they submitted an issue for

fields.description:
When a Puppy Concierge (PC) is working their leads in LeadTracker, this page shows up whether they are on "Recent Contacts" or any other field such as _Hot Leads, Warm Leads_, etc.

I would like the *Edited* column (where the the date appears) to be extended and show the time stamp to the right of the date.  This would allow the PC to sort by time.

PC's each make approximately 100 calls per day.  If they did not get a hold of the customer in the morning, then they are expected to try again in the afternoon, and yet again in the evening.  Being able to sort by not only date, but also the time of day on when the lead was last updated, will allow them to easily view which customers need to be followed upon next.  If you have any questions, please let me know.  - Chris Ramsey

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Label Restrictions are ignored and incorrect name is shown for linked project when Searching from the main Help Center (<base_URL>/servicedesk/customer/portals), If the KB space is linked to two Projects and each Project has KB restricted by labels then the Helpdesk name next to the kb Title in the search results will display only one of the two Portal names next to it that the customer is a member of the customer list, where is should show the Portal the article is restricted to via the label

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Create 2 Service desk Projects:
** Project A
** Project B 
* Confirm customer is on the customer list of both projects
* Create Confluence Space:
** TEST
* Link each of the two projects to the TESRT KB space:
** [Serving customers with a knowledge base | https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/serving-customers-with-a-knowledge-base-732528995.html]
* Create two Pages in the TEST space with labels:
** Project A page
*** Lebel: project_a
** Project B page 
*** Lebel: project_b
* Add the label restriction to the Project configuration >> Knowledge base per project
* Search KB for the term project from the Main Help Center portal

h3. Expected Results
The portal name next to the page title would display each portal respectively
* Project A page . Project A
* Project B page . Project B

h3. Actual Results
Both Results show the same Project name:
* Project A page . Project B
* Project B page . Project B
!Screen Shot 2017-06-27 at 9.48.05 AM.png|thumbnail!

 h3. Notes
If you remove the customer from the customer list on Project B the Project displayed for the search result will display Project A:
!Screen Shot 2017-06-27 at 9.55.17 AM.png|thumbnail!

h3.Workaround
Link each Service Desk Project to a single Space
fields.summary: KB search doesn't use label restriction on Help Centre page and single service desk page + shows incorrect portal in search results when same space is linked to multiple SD projects
create a user friendly system

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The Documentation for the [/rest/servicedeskapi/request/\{issueIdOrKey}/attachment|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/service-desk/rest/#api-request-issueIdOrKey-attachment-post] is incomplete and misleading. Indeed:
 # It is not immediate to understand that 2 different REST Calls are needed to attach a file to a JIRA Service Desk issue (one to attach the file to the Service Desk project, and one to attach it to the issue as explained in [JSDECO-10|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/JSDECO-10]
 # It contains a broken link to the endpoint servicedesk/\{serviceDeskId}/attachTemporaryFile 
 # The example is using the key {{"get_public": "boolean"}} that does not exist. It is {{"public": "boolean"}} instead.
 # It says that, in order to use experimental methods, you must include the "{{X-ExperimentalApi: true}}" header in your requests. This works but when sending the request without the header to the instance, this replies saying that you should use "{{X-ExperimentalApi: opt-in}}". Both headers actually work (as you can see I have used both of them in below examples) but it should be mentioned in the doc.

h3. Workaround/Solution:

1) You can achieve the same result by using the JIRA Core REST API endpoint to add an attachment to an issue as explained in:
 - [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-attach-an-attachment-in-a-jira-issue-using-rest-api-699957734.html/]

2) You can use 2 calls to attach the files as in the below example (adding 2 attachments first to the project and then to the issue):
 - *Adding the files to the project (endpoint: servicedesk/\{serviceDeskId}/attachTemporaryFile):*
{noformat}
curl -D- -u USER:PASSWORD -H "X-Atlassian-Token: nocheck" -H "X-ExperimentalApi: true" -F "file=@/path/to/file/test2.txt" -X POST https://INSTANCE.atlassian.net/rest/servicedeskapi/servicedesk/SERVICE_DESK_ID/attachTemporaryFile
....
HTTP/1.1 100 Continue
.....
HTTP/1.1 201 Created
......
{"temporaryAttachments":[{"temporaryAttachmentId":"5ad41f7b-882a-4f12-8a08-9b401d6dd3bf","fileName":"test2.txt"}]} 



curl -D- -u USER:PASSWORD -H "X-Atlassian-Token: nocheck" -H "X-ExperimentalApi: opt-in" -F "file=@/path/to/file/test3.txt" -X POST https://INSTANCE.atlassian.net/rest/servicedeskapi/servicedesk/SERVICE_DESK_ID/attachTemporaryFile
.....
{"temporaryAttachments":[{"temporaryAttachmentId":"3f9ff4f9-99a0-4ee0-868e-8b93c8c67bee","fileName":"test3.txt"}]} 
{noformat}

 
 - *Adding the files to the issue (endpoint: /rest/servicedeskapi/request/\{issueIdOrKey}/attachment):*
{noformat}
curl -D- -u USER:PASSWORD -H "Accept: application/json" -H "Content-Type: application/json" -H "X-ExperimentalApi: opt-in" -d '{"additionalComment": {"body": "TEST JSD ENDPOINT: adding 2 attachments"}, "public": "true","temporaryAttachmentIds": ["5ad41f7b-882a-4f12-8a08-9b401d6dd3bf", "3f9ff4f9-99a0-4ee0-868e-8b93c8c67bee"]}' -X POST https://INSTANCE.atlassian.net/rest/servicedeskapi/request/ISSUE_ID/attachment
.....
HTTP/1.1 201 Created
.....
{"comment":{"_expands":["attachment","renderedBody"],"id":"10504","body":"TEST JSD ENDPOINT: adding 2 attachments\n\n[^test2.txt] _(0.0 kB)_\n\n[^test3.txt] _(0.0 kB)_","public":true,...............} 
{noformat}
fields.summary: The REST API endpoint /rest/servicedeskapi/request/{issueIdOrKey}/attachment documentation needs to be fixed

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using IE 11 to view Service Desk project, the Queue page is not consistently loading. The page will display as a blank page after a while when move from one page to another page and come back

h3. Environment
* JIRA Service Desk Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Login by using IE11
# Access Service Desk Project and go to Queue
# You can see the Queue page is loading correctly
# Hovers to other menu, such as go to other project, administration, etc
# Go back to your Service Desk Project and go to Queue

h3. Expected Results
- The queue page will be displayed 

h3. Actual Results
- The queue page is not loading. Instead, it is showing as a blank page
 
h3.Workaround
- Use Other browsers, such as Chrome and Firefox
- Refresh, clear cache and use incognito mode works temporarily but the problem will come back after a while
fields.summary: Service Desk Queue Page is not consistently displayed on IE 11 (will display a blank page after some navigation)

fields.description:
h3. Current Behaviour:

Currently, the SLA reports seem to change units fluidly, presumably dependent upon what the smallest and largest values are within the data being pulled. 

h3. Desired Behaviour: 

Such reports would be much more useful to carry out comparisons if we were able to choose a consistent unit of measure for the report to apply regardless of highs and lows. We want to be able to specify if we want the results in minutes, hours, weeks, or months.
fields.summary: Ability to set a static time unit for Service Desk Reports

fields.description:
As a Service Desk Agent, I would like to have the ability to perform issue actions from email.

h4. Example: 
{{#Status Resolved}} would resolve the issue
{{#Time 10m}} would log 10 minutes on the issue.

This request is to have the ability to do pretty much what [Smart Commits|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/processing-jira-software-issues-with-smart-commit-messages-298979931.html] already do in JSW issues.
fields.summary: Ability to execute issue actions from email.

fields.description:

* Bot needs real data and feedback
* If bot is uncertain of answer it will handover the question to human co-worker

fields.description:
What are the correct steps to integrate JIRA Service Desk Cloud application with 3rd party Service Desk in following scenario: two different companies (Company 1 and Company 2) share a common customer, but customer wants to use only one service desk on Company 1.

The only way I have almost found to do this is to use Email Requests. 

* Company 1
** 3rd Party Service Desk: https://support.company1.com
** Service Desk Key: CUSTOMER[date].[index]
** Customer: jira@company2.atlassian.net
** Email Requests Enabled: Yes
** Email Request: support@company1.com
* Company 2
** Jira Service Desk Cloud: https://company2.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/sdcustomer
** Customer Key: SDCUSTOMER
** Customer: support@company1.com
** Email Requests Enabled: Yes
** Email Request: sdcustomer.support@company2.com

When Customer / Company 1 raises a ticket 
# Ticket ID is CUSTOMER20170615.0001
# 3rd party system automatically sends a notificiation email from support@company1.com to Company 2 email sdcustomer.support@company2.com
# Then with the help of Azure Logic Apps, do some filter and replacing on email subject line, and resend the mail to sdcustomer.support@company2.com
# Because support@company1.com is found on Company 2 Service Desk customers-list a ticket is created with ID SDCUSTOMER-1

When Customer / Company 1 comments ticket CUSTOMER20170615.0001 
# 3rd party system automatically sends a notificiation email from support@company1.com to Company 2 email sdcustomer.support@company2.com
# Then with the help of Azure Logic Apps, do some filter and replacing on email subject line, and resend the mail to sdcustomer.support@company2.com
# If SDCUSTOMER key is missing from subject-line, Jira will create a new (duplicate) ticket. Needs a lot of manual work.

Is there another way of doing this? E.g. setting up source and target Service Desk applications would be nice.
fields.summary: How to integrate Jira Service Desk Cloud application and 3rd party Service Desk?

fields.description:
What are the correct steps to integrate two JIRA Service Desk Cloud applications in following scenario: two different companies (Company 1 and Company 2) share a common customer, but customer wants to use only one service desk.

The only way I have found to do this is to use Email Requests. 
It is not the most elegant way of doing things (error-prone), but somewhat works.

* Company 1
** JIRA Service Desk Cloud: https://company1.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/sdcustomer
** Service Desk Key: SDCUSTOMER
** Customer: jira@company2.atlassian.net
** Email Requests Enabled: Yes
** Email Request: sdcustomer.support@company1.com
* Company 2
** JIRA Service Desk Cloud: https://company2.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/sdcustomer
** Customer Key: SDCUSTOMER
** Customer: jira@company1.atlassian.net
** Email Requests Enabled: Yes
** Email Request: sdcustomer.support@company2.com

When Company 1 raises a ticket 
# Ticket ID is SDCUSTOMER-1
# Jira automatically sends a notificiation email from jira@company1.atlassian.net to Company 2 email sdcustomer.support@company2.com
# Because jira@company1.atlassian.net is found on Company 2 Service Desk customers-list a ticket is created with ID SDCUSTOMER-1

When Company 2 comments ticket SDCUSTOMER-1
# Jira automatically sends a notificiation email from jira@company2.atlassian.net to Company 1 email sdcustomer.support@company1.com
# Because jira@company2.atlassian.net is found on Company 1 Service Desk customers-list and ticketID SDCUSTOMER-1 is found on email subject line, it will add comment to SDCUSTOMER-1 ticket

Pre-requisities etc
* Service Desk Key must have excact match (SDCUSTOMER)
* Service Desk Key numbering must have excact match, in order for comments to go to correct ticket (SDCUSTOMER-1)
* To keep things synced, deleting tickets or adding test-tickets should not be allowed on either party. 

Is there another way of doing this? E.g. setting up source and target Jira Service Desk applications would be nice.
fields.summary: How to integrate two Jira Service Desk Cloud applications?

fields.description:
I'm looking o create a quick report on the Home Page of Lead Tracker that will allow me to pull reports by location.  I need to pull Utah sales reports and Florida Sales Reports separately and give it a % to Plan for the month.  

I would also like to take a couple of unused reports in Lead Tracker today and update them to make them usable for today's purposes.  Is there someone I can sit with for about 90 minutes and outline some key reports I need to create for Sales Management purposes?
fields.summary: New Reports Needed in Lead Tracker

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When accessing an issue for the first time, in a JIRA Software instance only, the Service Desk request type field gets created automatically. In addition, the person who accessed the issue appears in the JIRA audit log as the creator of the field which is not correct, as it's the system creating the field.

h3. Environment

JIRA Software Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Provision a JIRA Software instance only
# Install an add-on
# Acess an issue

h3. Expected Results

As the instance is JIRA Software only, no SD field should be created at all.

h3. Actual Results

The field is created and the audit log shows the user accessing a ticket as the creator of the field.
fields.summary: Atlassian Connect causes the Request Type field to be created in a JIRA Software only instance

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce:
# Launch Microsoft Edge Browser
# Go to Service Desk Project
# Click on Project Settings > Request Types
# Click on Edit Groups in one of the request type
# A popup will be shown to assign the request types to group
# Click Save
# Close the pop-up and click on add existing request type
# Type in request type

h3. Expected Results:
The request types will be added to group correctly

h3. Actual Results:
# The save button is not working. There is no respond from clicking the save button
# After add existing request type, upon typing in request type in the, the pop-up disappear and the request type does not appear in the group listings

h3. Workaround:
Use another browser
fields.summary: Adding a request type to group and add existing request type is not working on Microsoft Edge

fields.description:
Some teams would like their System Dashboard to be accessible publicly too allow users to see what items are being worked on, review the roadmap, and vote/comment on items.

 

Non-logged in users are able to access the System Dashboard without issues however once a Service Desk customer logs in, they're redirected to the Customer Portal and that is all they can access. This feature request is asking to allow logged in Service Desk customers to be able to view the JIRA System Dashboard instead of being redirected to the Customer Portal like they are currently.
fields.summary: Allow JIRA Service Desk customers to access JIRA System Dashboard

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, we have these two options for Service desk admins to define the approver choice:
 * Let the customer choose who will approve, however, they will be able to choose between all the users they can share requests with
 * Hide the approver field, so that all the approvers will be notified for each request, but only one will need to approve it. However, this option will break our actions from Question 1.

However, for some use cases, admins would like to: *provide a list of users* where the customer would choose the approver in this specific list of users, not all the users
h3. Suggested Solution

Provide a way for that admins can set-up a list (or use a group) of people who can be suggested as approver in the field
h3. Workaround

[How to add a specific list of approvers|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Service-Management-articles/How-to-add-a-specific-list-of-approvers/ba-p/869692]
fields.summary: Ability to limit approvers for customer approver choice

fields.description:
h3. JIRA Service Desk Email notifications only include thumbnail of attachments. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Update a ticket (add an image in a comment) in a Jira Service Desk Project
# Notification is sent to the reporter and participants. 
# The notification that is sent out only includes a thumbnail of the attachment. 

At the moment when customers received notification; they need to be logged to the customer portal to be able to view the images.


h3. What would be great.
If the images were displayed properly in the image body.
fields.summary: Service desk email to include attachments

fields.description:
Currently, Service Desk Agents receive notifications as per JIRA Notification email template, which is not customizable.

It would be great to have the ability to customize the content of emails sent to Agents, possibly including variables such as customer organization, request types and etc.

 
h3. Workaround

You can use *Automation* to do this (you may want to disable the default Jira notifications that you are going to replace with the custom ones).

You can find the *Automation* option in your project settings. Be careful not to confuse it with the *Legacy* *Automation* option present in the same menu.

 

For further details on this please see:
 * [Jira Automation|https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/features/automation]
 * [Automate your Jira Cloud processes and workflows|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/automate-your-jira-cloud-processes-and-workflows/]
fields.summary: Add the ability to customize Agent Notifications

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently, when users add multiple attachments while creating an issue in customer portal. It will only take the latest attachment. For example, if there are *Attachment 1* and *Attachment 2*, when the issue is created, it'll consist of 2 *Attachments 2*. It only affects when the attachments are added by screenshot (Copy and Paste). For example, Snipping Tool for Windows.

  !image-2017-06-12-15-50-04-470.png|thumbnail!

 
h3. Steps to Replicate
 # Create an issue in customer portal.
 # Attach multiple attachments.
 # Create the issue
 # It'll only use the newest attached image.

h3. Expected Result

It'll create the issue with the proper attachments.
h3. Current Result

It is only taking the newest attached image.

  !image-2017-06-12-15-51-01-733.png|thumbnail!

UPDATE: This issue also happens when the images are posted in a different time or days after. If a customer pastes an image at the moment a ticket is opened and then paste another image on the next week and so on, but with the same name, it will show the thumbnail of the first image always. In some cases, it can also pick the last image and updated all other thumbnails. It can be confirmed by going to "Manage Attachments" where you can see the order of the attachments.
fields.summary: Multiple attachments in customer portal not added properly

fields.description: It would be interesting to have the option to customize even more the JSD portal.

Right now you can search your approved, approvals using Approval = approved() but there is no easy way to search for the declined ones.

It does not allow for any other operator other than = and the pending() option exists so,  could it be possible to have a declined option too?

Regards!

Rudy

fields.description:
h3.Summary

Emails (with request key) from unregistered users should be added as comment to existing tickets when public sign on is turned on. Currently the behavior is that unregistered emails are added as new emails when public sign  up is enabled; all emails are also raised as new tickets regardless if the title contains a request key or not 

h3.Use Case

Since customers can be registered with an email alias, notifications that are sent to the email alias are sent to all email under the alias. So when the customer reply with an unregistered email, a new user is created but the email will be created as a ticket instead of being appended as a comment (even though they are replying to a notification).
fields.summary: Emails from unregistered users should be added as comment to existing tickets when public sign on is turned on

fields.description:
h2. Problem Definition
At the moment, JIRA Service Desk only supports converting portal-only customers to Atlassian Accounts and it is not possible to bulk convert application users to portal-only customers. The only way to convert these users to portal-only customer is by revoking application access manually in User Management.

h2. Suggested Solution
Provide the ability to bulk convert application users to JSD portal-only customer.
fields.summary: Provide the ability to bulk convert application users to portal-only customers

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When sending an email to the default JIRA Service Desk inbox, _xxx_@_instancename_.atlassian.net, the emails are being bounced back with a failed delivery message. 

h3. Environment

JIRA Service Desk Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Configure the email requests in your JIRA Service Desk project. 
# Send an email to _xxx_@_instancename_.atlassian.net

h3. Expected Results

Email is received by JIRA Service Desk, and issue or comment is created.

h3. Actual Results

No ticket/comment is created and an email is received with the following failed delivery message.

'This message could not be delivered.
Action: failed
Final-Recipient: rfc822; _xxx_@_instancename_.atlassian.net
Original-Recipient: rfc822; _xxx_@_instancename_.atlassian.net
Diagnostic-Code: smtp; 550 5.1.1 Mailbox does not exist
Status: 5.1.1'

h3.Workaround

Atlassian support has a manual workaround to re-enable the mailbox. Please raise a ticket with support to have this resolved.
fields.summary: Emails sent to JIRA Service Desk default inbox are bounced back

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Goto JIRA Service Desk configuration from within the Global Administration
 # Click on "View and customize"

h3. Expected

You are redirected to the Help Center with the "Customize" side panel open
h3. Actual

You are redirected to the single portal view instead, which doesn't not have a sidepanel available
h3. Workaround

You have two options available:
 * From within the Single portal view, click on the "Help Center" link and then on the "Customize" button that appears in the top right hand corner
 * or; create another Service Desk project, and the link will work again
fields.summary: View and customize link doesn't work if you only have one service desk

Contact site-admin to change the password from *User Management* > *Portal Only Customer**s*

fields.description:
h3. Problem

When customers send a request via email, attaching two images with the same file name, JIRA will not display the images correctly.

h3. Steps to reproduce the problem

# Send an email to the support email address with two images attached with the same file name.

h3. Expected result

Two different images will be uploaded and displayed.

h3. Actual result

Two images are uploaded, however, they look exactly the same in the Customer Portal. In JIRA all the images appear correctly under Attachments but in the Comments tab, the attachments seem to be the first one added.

h3. Workaround

Upload images only with different file names.
fields.summary: Images with the same filename appear as a single attachment in the Customer Portal

fields.description: Service Desk Email requests can can have only two required fields - Summary and Description. When trying to make another field required in the Email request settings you will get notified that this cannot be done. If, however, you use same Field Configuration for all issue types (including email requests) you can change the Field Configuration so that it has more required fields. This will overrule the Email request settings and as a result all email requests will fail - this can have great impact. There is currently no notification or warning message informing you about that.
fields.summary: Erros message when changing field configuration affecting email request

fields.description:

Steps to reproduce:

# Move issue to the status Done
Expected results: Resolution even is fired 
Actual result: Resolution is set in DB but even wasn't fired, so SLA is never stopped
 !_SDQE-47__Complete_https___qa-challenges-curiosity_atlassian_io_-_JSD_VDOG.jpg|thumbnail!
fields.summary: SLA is never stopped when setting resolution/assignee twice

fields.description:
h2.Summary

If user has reported request with empty request type, running {{/rest/servicedeskapi/request}} will return the error below.

h3.Steps to Replicate

# Find a service desk project and create a dummy request type.
# Create a request with the dummy request type.
# Delete the dummy request type.
# The request should now be in a similar state with the screenshot below.
!Untitled.png!
# Run {{https://<domain_name>.atlassian.net/rest/servicedeskapi/request/<request_key>}} on the browser.

h3.Expected Results

The REST end point should return all request raised by the user regardless if the request type is empty or not.

{noformat}
{"size":0,"start":0,"limit":50,"isLastPage":true,"_links":{"base":"https://natexo.atlassian.net","context":"","self":"https://natexo.atlassian.net/rest/servicedeskapi/request"},"values":[]}
{noformat}

h3.Current Results

The REST end point currently returns a pretty ambiguous error.

{noformat}
{"errorMessage":"The request type you are trying to view does not exist.","i18nErrorMessage":{"i18nKey":"sd.customerview.error.requestTypeNotFound","parameters":[]}}
{noformat}

h3.Workaround

Ensure there are no request has an invalid request type. Use JQL to filter out issues with empty customer request type.
fields.summary: /rest/servicedeskapi/request returning error when request type is empty

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In confluence page , have an achor link created. When clicking the link, the page should drop down to the anchor. But , in JSD KB it open a new window instead of dropping down to the anchored.
h3. Environment
 * JSD v3.3.0-OD-1000.1329.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a page in confluence and configure the anchor macro.
# Open the KB at customer portal and click the link. 

h3. Expected Results

It should drop down to the anchored within the JSD KB viewer.
h3. Actual Results

It open a new window to the chrome-less page content (no JSD KB viewer chrome around it, not the Confluence page link either)
fields.summary: Clicking an anchor link within a KB article opens a new tab on the chrome-less KB article content

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Configure JIRA service desk project to turn on email request (can use either cloud email address or custom email address as it does not matter)
 # Ensure the "Who can customers share requests with?" option is set to "Other customers in their organization. If they're not in an organization, they won't find anyone." in the customer permissions settings page.
 # Create a customer org with two customers
 # Create two customers _not_ in the customer org
 # Add your own email account as a customer in the org
 # Send an email form your own email account to the email address that was configured in Step 1 above, with a mixture of customers that are not in the org and those that are (use TO or CC, it doen't matter)

h3. Expected Results

Those customers who are in the org, are included as request participants in the created request. Those customers who are not in the org are not included.

h3. Actual Results

No customers are included as request participants, not even those who are part of the customer org.

h3. Workaround

Do not include customers who are not part of the customer org in the TO or CC fields.
fields.summary: For issues that are automatically created via e-mail, if any of the request participants in the TO or CC fields are not in the reporters org, then none are added as participants

fields.description:
We have an integration between our time reporting/ invoice system and JIRA Service desk. How we did this:
 * using webhook
 * We have added a required custom field to every issue so that the hours reported in work log in JIRA will be transfered to our time reporting/ invoice system. This is because we then can use only JIRA to log hours, and doesn´t have to report the same hours more then ones.

Problem/ issue for us:
 * The project number is nothing that the customer must see
 ** But when I add a required field I must hide it from the customer 
 ** When I choose to hide the field from the customer I must fill in a default value and then the field misses it point to be required as you no longer will get an error message (that you must fill in the project number).

 

Do you have a solution for us?
fields.summary: JIRA Service desk: hiding a required field from the customer portal requires that I fill in a value

fields.description: I like to see fields like "priority" or custom fields in the customer portal for the requests my customers send.
fields.summary: As a customer i like to see the priority set to my request from the portal

fields.description:
With the Atlassian account roll out, many customers are complaining about not being able to manage the password for their users even though they are portal-only users, but are not listed under *Portal only customer* in the User Management. 

For a user to be treated as a portal-only customer, the user needs to be invited from within Service Desk projects (Customers tab) or by signing up for their own accounts, if they have permission to. If one doesn't know this and create the user through the "Create user" button, there is no option to make this user appears under "portal only customer" and hence, manually changing the password is not possible.

Back in the days, there used to be a checkbox "Restricted access user" which would easily turn a user into a portal-only customer.
fields.summary: Ability to easily turn users into "portal only customers"

fields.description: Is it possible to enable other variables in OTC bar queries? It’d be useful to be able to choose some other price fields (e.g. bid and ask in the quote category, available in the raw option). I could compute bars myself, but the raw tic data is too time-resolved (and downloads are too slow) to do this for any reasonably large set of securities over a reasonable time period. Please advise.
fields.summary: other variables in OTC bar queries

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, the logo and Help Center name is shared across all portals in the same JIRA Service Desk instance.
h3. Suggested Solution
Allow configuring different logo and Help Center name for different portals.
h3. Why this is important
 In some situations, organizations cater to different customers for different products and require using different logo and Help Center name to avoid confusion.
fields.summary: Allow configuring different logo and Help Center name for different portals

fields.description:
I saw _Language Support_ feature in Service Desk projects recently, which is really good to have, to enable internationalization.

I was looking for Dutch Translation option, which I could not find actually. Many of our customer are from this region only. So it would be really great to include support of Dutch language too.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Ability to access and manage Cloud email address for Service Desk project
Location: Project settings -> Email Requests

h3. Suggested Solution
Advised customer to use Customer email address

h3. Why this is important
Customer would like to have this feature as part of their email redirection for Cloud - Server migration.
fields.summary: Ability to manage SD Cloud email address

fields.description:
As per mentioned in [Select the right account for your JIRA Service Desk customers|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/select-the-right-account-for-your-jira-service-desk-customers-873871210.html] documentation, the workaround to convert users to portal-only customers can be done:
# by selecting _Restricted portal access_ checkbox in the user account
# by going to yoursitename.atlassian.net/admin/portal-users-migration URL to bulk convert users to portal only customers

However, as mentioned in [here|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-5384], the second solution can only be used prior to the introduction of Atlassian Accounts:
{quote}That page was added to allow administrators to mark users as portal only for a limited time prior to the introduction of Atlassian Account. Once Atlassian account is active (more specifically, the Identity Platform migration is completed) this functionality is not available anymore, because the two types of user accounts now live in separate places.{quote}

As for the first workaround, there is no more _Restricted portal access_ checkbox available in an individual user account.

It would be great if the information in the documentation can be updated accordingly to reflect the current behavior.
fields.summary: Improve "Select the right account for your JIRA Service Desk customers" documentation
Create tickets from a Website Form thru email with SMTP protocol declare Reporter incorrectly

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* When trying to reset a customer password via the JIRA Service Desk Project > Customers tab, the JIRA Service Desk administrator is directed to User Management e.g. https://{{INSTANCE_NAME}}.atlassian.net/admin/users/view?username={{CUSTOMER_EMAIL_ADDRESS}}.
* Password reset email is sent, but the URL in the password reset link resets the customer's Atlassian ID password.
* JIRA Service Desk customers do not authenticate using Atlassian ID.
* The password reset feature has no effect on the JIRA Service Desk customer account - the password on a customer account(portal only) stays the same.

h3. Environment
* JSD 1000.1313.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce.
# Create new customer in JSD.
# Customer accepts invitation sent via email.
# Customer sets a "Display name" and password e.g. "Password123".
# JIRA Service Desk admin resets customer password by hovering the mouse pointer over the customer account; More > Administer.  The JIRA Service Desk Admin is directed to User Management(https://{{INSTANCE_NAME}}.atlassian.net/admin/users/view?username={{CUSTOMER_EMAIL_ADDRESS}}).
# Password email sent to customer.
# If customer doesn't have an Atlassian ID, customer is prompted to sign up for an Atlassian ID.  If the customer has an Atlassian ID, then the customer is prompted to reset the Atlassian ID password.
# After the customer sets a new password.
# Customer tries to log into the Service Desk Portal with new credentials - login fails.

h3. Expected Results
* Password is reset and access to the Service Desk Portal is granted.

h3. Actual Results
* Customer receives an error message: "Sorry, your email and password are incorrect - please try again."
* Access is not granted.
 
h3. Notes
* Using the original password("Password123" in our example) that was set will allow the customer to log into the Service Desk Portal.  
* The password reset feature has no effect on the JIRA Service Desk customer account.

h3.Workaround
* Navigate to: https://{{INSTANCE_NAME}}.atlassian.net/admin/jira-service-desk/portal-only-customers/view?username={{USERNAME}} (in most cases the email address is the username) and update the customer's password from there
fields.summary: Password reset feature has no effect on customer accounts on JIRA Service Desk
Contributors macro doesn't work in the anonymous portal
Livesearch macro doesn't work in the anonymous portal

fields.description:
h3. Summary
After the migration, if a site-admin mistakenly creates the customer on the "Users" page in Site Administration, even without any application access, they are not moved to "Portal only customers" and also these users will have to use SSO (id.atlassian.com) to enter the customer portals.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an user under "Site Administration > User Management > Users"
# Do not grant access to any applications on the instance

h3. Expected Results
They should be portal only customers now and be listed under the "Portal only customers" page for site administrators.

h3. Actual Results
They still get listed under "Users" and need to use SSO (id.atlassian.com) to login to a customer portal.
 
h3. Notes
Users that already own an Atlassian Accounts that join a customer portal with the same email, will create an exclusive password and this instance customer user will have no relation with their Atlassian Accounts, it won't login using SSO (id.atlassian.com) and it won't use the full name.

h3.Workaround
Currently there is no workaround to convert an user to a customer portal only user.

This workaround is no longer listing these users to be converted: https://<instance>.atlassian.net/admin/portal-users-migration
fields.summary: JSD customers created under "Users" are not being listed under "Portal only customers" if all application access is revoked.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Service Desk Customers may experience an issue when trying to create a new IT Help Service Desk project within their instance and receive an error indicating:
"Hmm...we couldn't create your project due to an unknown error.  Try refreshing the page to start again."

However a Basic Service Desk Project can be created

h3. Environment
* Cloud 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a New Service Desk Project using the IT Help project type

h3. Expected Results
Project is created without error. 

h3. Actual Results
In the JIRA Logs:
{noformat}
2017-05-19 16:50:32.831346500 	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.sla.configuration.SLAGettingStartedServiceImpl.lambda$createTimeToApproveNormalChangeGoals$20(SLAGettingStartedServiceImpl.java:531)
2017-05-19 16:50:32.831346500 	at io.atlassian.fugue.Option$Some.forEach(Option.java:454)
2017-05-19 16:50:32.831347500 	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.sla.configuration.SLAGettingStartedServiceImpl.createTimeToApproveNormalChangeGoals(SLAGettingStartedServiceImpl.java:512)
2017-05-19 16:50:32.831352500 	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.sla.configuration.SLAGettingStartedServiceImpl.lambda$createTimeToApproveNormalChangeMetricForEmptyProject$18(SLAGettingStartedServiceImpl.java:501)
2017-05-19 16:50:32.831358500 	at io.atlassian.fugue.Either$RightProjection.flatMap(Either.java:870)
2017-05-19 16:50:32.831359500 	at io.atlassian.fugue.Either.flatMap(Either.java:230)
2017-05-19 16:50:32.831359500 	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.sla.configuration.SLAGettingStartedServiceImpl.createTimeToApproveNormalChangeMetricForEmptyProject(SLAGettingStartedServiceImpl.java:501)
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
Support can confirm this issue, however if the options in the Change Type Custom Field have been modified and the option for "Normal" has been removed, the Service Desk project will fail creation.

h3.Workaround
Add "Normal" as an option for the Change Type Custom Field

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The users used to be able to edit a customer's JIRA user properties, they stored data like phones or other relevant details for their customers on JSD.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an instance without Atlassian Account enabled.
# Create users with the "Restricted portal access" option checked.
# Enable the instance to Atlassian Account integrated.
# Go to "Portal-only customers", click on a customer to open its profile.

h3. Expected Results
Have the option after "Reset password" to edit Project roles and User properties.

h3. Actual Results
The option is no longer available.
 
h3. Notes
After setting up the user properties, they used to be displayed on the customer's profile, the behaviour is no longer happening after enabling Atlassian Account on the instance as well.

h3.Workaround
To edit an user JIRA properties, use this link below and replace the data within the brackets.
https://<instance>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/user/EditUserProperties.jspa?name=<username>
fields.summary: Customer JIRA Properties are no longer accessible to be edited after the Atlassian Account upgrade.

*Steps to reproduce:*

_1) Associate a field related to a customer survey (Satisfaction, for example) to a transition screen in JIRA Service Desk._

*Expected Result:*

_The transition will occur normally._

*Current result:*

_JIRA will not transition the issue due to the immutable custom field and will return a blank error message (with no information whatsoever)._

_Remove the field association with the screen._

*Thank you.*

Increase limit on API JSON above 50, to at least 100

None

None.

h3. Notes
Other 2 workflows successfully created appear on the Inactive workflows sections starting with the name of the project.

h3. Problem:
The text "Approbation par gestionnaire de modification/évaluation par les pairs" is longer than 60 characters.
The translation is for the status called: "Peer review / change manager approval" in the 
[Change management|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/change-management-817562147.html] workflow.

The problem is new as it was found working on earlier versions where the workflow was created in English.

h3.Workaround
Change "Default language" / "Langue par défaut" to English before creating the IT Service Desk project and switch back to French afterwards.
Note: the workflow will be created in English.
fields.summary: Unable to create IT project in French language

fields.description:
Today, the satisfaction survey can only be answered by the mail channel.

It would be great if the satisfaction survey could be added to the customer portal when an issue is resolved too, so the customers can avoid the use of the email channel instead of the consolidated customer portal.
fields.summary: Enable customer satisfaction survey on the Customer Portal

fields.description:
We allow anybody to submit issues to our help desk, because we support internal staff, as well as external users. This sometimes create dupliicated accounts, due to variations or aliases in e-mail addresses.

It would be great if we could merge two customer accounts to be able to also re-assign all reporters on current and past issues.
fields.summary: Merging customers

fields.description:
h3. Summary

After enabling Atlassian Account, JIRA is returning an error message (*_User does not exist)_* when navigating to *administer user* on Service Desk.
h3. Environment

Cloud - JIRA v1000.929.1
h3. Steps to Reproduce

  # Navigate to a Service Desk Project

  # Click on *customers*

  # Roll the mouse on a customer which doesn't have a JIRA Account (Restricted Portal) > More > Administer User.
h3. Expected Result

It displays the Site Administration screen and the default options (*Log in as User, Reset password, etc)*
h3. Actual Results

It displays an error message: _User *user1* does not exist._

 
h3. _Workaround:_

_Convert the user to Atlassian Account enable again the *Administer User* option._
fields.summary: Unable to administer customers on JIRA Service Desk

fields.description:
We are currently using cloud based JIRA and Service Desk.

We created multiple Service Desks to have different permissions for different request types (ie. anybody can report a bug, only content teams have access to submit a content change, only network teams can request a DNS change, etc)

For 90% of the requests, they get resolved right from the Service Desk.

For the other 10%, they need to be moved to the backlog on one of the Development teams boards, so that they can be prioritized and working into an upcoming sprint.  

We recently started receiving reports from customers that their requests were "disappearing".  Sure enough, we tested it out, and as soon as the ticket was moved to the developer board, it could no longer be viewed via the customer portal.  

I have contacted Atlassian support, and was told that once a ticket is moved, it is no longer considered a service desk ticket, and is no longer accessable from the service desk.  I haven't received anything even remotely close to an acceptable solution or work around.

We need some way of getting the ticket (or a ticket) to the developers Scrum board, yet still have the customer be aware of what is going on
fields.summary: Customer can no longer see their requests after being moved to Dev Scrum Board

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When an agent creates a ticket for himself/herself, he/she receives satisfaction survey after resolving his/her own ticket.

h3. Suggested Solution

Create an option not to send customer satisfaction surveys when assignee and reporter are the same person.

h3. Why this is important

This problem makes the rating data dirty, as the agent will probably rate himself/herself always with 5 stars.
fields.summary: Ability to disable customer satisfaction surveys when assignee and reporter are the same person

fields.description:
When anonymous request creation is enabled, the sign up form in the customer portal does not display password policy information in the modal that appears next to the password field.

*Steps to reproduce*
 # Create a project with JSD and enable public signup for that project, make sure anonymous request creation is disabled
 # View that project as an anonymous user in the customer portal
 # Navigate to the sign up page and note that there is a password recipe indicator to the right of the password field
 # Enable anonymous request creation for that project
 # Reload the sign up page—the password recipe indicator will no longer be there

 

*Expected results*

Projects with anonymous request creation enabled should have the password policy information on the sign up form
fields.summary: Password strength information hint not on user signup form when anonymous request creation enabled

fields.description:
If we didn't have any issues that matched an SLA query, it reports the SLAs as 0% rather than 100%.

 

Also, if a technician received no satisfaction survey ratings for a day, it reports their rating as 0 for the day. 

 

This is also really misleading people looking at a graph/chart.
fields.summary: Points on report showing 0 for NULL

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When commenting on an issue while assigning it to a user, the customer notification sent will contain the comment twice.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Service Desk Issue via the portal
# Ensure reporter is a customer
# Using a service desk agent, assign issue to a service desk agent using assign button
# Add a customer facing comment when performing the assignment
# Check email account associated with the customer account for the notification

h3. Expected Results
Customer notification should contain the comment only once, like any other customer facing comment:
{quote}
Service Desk Agent commented:

Assigning this issue to an agent to investigate.
{quote}

h3. Actual Results
Customer notification contains the comment twice:
{quote}
Service Desk Agent commented:

Assigning this issue to an agent to investigate.

----

Service Desk Agent commented:

Assigning this issue to an agent to investigate.
{quote}

h3.Workaround

Comment after doing the assignment so a normal customer notification is sent.
fields.summary: Duplicated comment in customer notification when commenting on assignment
